content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you can define the function in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return [word for word in words if isupper(first(word))]
end
```
This function uses list comprehension to iterate over each word in `words`. The condition `isupper(first(word))` checks whether the first character of the word (which is assumed to be a single Unicode character) is an uppercase letter. If it is, the word is included in the output; otherwise, it is not.

Note that `isupper` returns true if and only if its argument is an uppercase letter at the beginning of a string. The function `first(s)` returns the first (and in this case only) character of the string `s`.
